statements.query: MATCH (n) where n.exposed_internet IS NOT NULL AND labels(n) IN ['GCPInstance'] WITH n LIMIT $LIMIT_SIZE REMOVE n.exposed_internet, n.exposed_internet_type return COUNT(*) as TotalCompleted
statements.__comment__: Delete exposed_internet off nodes so we can start fresh

statements.query:
MATCH (vpc:GCPVpc)<-[mem:MEMBER_OF_GCP_VPC]-(inst:GCPInstance)-[t:TAGGED]->(tag:GCPNetworkTag)-[tt:TARGET_TAG]-(fw:GCPFirewall{direction: 'INGRESS'})<-[res:RESOURCE]-(vpc)
MERGE (fw)-[a:FIREWALL_INGRESS]->(inst)
ON CREATE SET a.firstseen = timestamp()
SET a.lastupdated = $UPDATE_TAG
RETURN count(*) as TotalCompleted
statements.__comment__: Connect GCP ingress firewall rules to the instances that they apply to via target tags

statements.query:
MATCH (fw:GCPFirewall{direction: 'INGRESS', has_target_service_accounts: False})
WHERE NOT (fw)-[:TARGET_TAG]->(:GCPNetworkTag)
match (inst:GCPInstance)-[mem:MEMBER_OF_GCP_VPC]->(vpc:GCPVpc)-[res:RESOURCE]->(fw)
MERGE (fw)-[a:FIREWALL_INGRESS]->(inst)
ON CREATE SET a.firstseen = timestamp()
SET a.lastupdated = $UPDATE_TAG
RETURN count(*) as TotalCompleted
statements.__comment__: Connect GCP ingress firewall rules that don't specify target tags and don't specify target service accounts to the instances that they apply to via sharing the same VPC

statements.query:
MATCH (fw:GCPFirewall)-[a:FIREWALL_INGRESS]->(inst:GCPInstance)
WHERE a.lastupdated <> $UPDATE_TAG
DELETE (a)
RETURN count(*) as TotalCompleted

MATCH (ac:GCPNicAccessConfig)<-[:RESOURCE]-(:GCPNetworkInterface)<-[:NETWORK_INTERFACE]-(n:GCPInstance)<-[:FIREWALL_INGRESS]-(firewall_a:GCPFirewall)<-[:ALLOWED_BY]-(allow_rule:GCPIpRule{protocol:'tcp'})<-[:MEMBER_OF_IP_RULE]-(:IpRange{id:"0.0.0.0/0"})
OPTIONAL MATCH (n)<-[:FIREWALL_INGRESS]-(firewall_b:GCPFirewall)<-[:DENIED_BY]-(deny_rule:GCPIpRule{protocol:'tcp'})
WHERE ac.public_ip IS NOT NULL and (
	deny_rule is NULL
	OR firewall_b.priority > firewall_a.priority
	OR NOT allow_rule.fromport IN RANGE(deny_rule.fromport, deny_rule.toport)
	OR NOT allow_rule.toport IN RANGE(deny_rule.fromport, deny_rule.toport)
)
SET n.exposed_internet = True, n.exposed_internet_type='direct'
RETURN count(*) as TotalCompleted
statements.__comment__: Mark a GCP instance with exposed_internet = True and exposed_internet_type = 'direct' if its attached firewalls and TCP rules expose it to the internet.

statements.query:
MATCH (ac:GCPNicAccessConfig)<-[:RESOURCE]-(:GCPNetworkInterface)<-[:NETWORK_INTERFACE]-(n:GCPInstance)<-[:FIREWALL_INGRESS]-(firewall_a:GCPFirewall)<-[:ALLOWED_BY]-(allow_rule:GCPIpRule{protocol:'all'})<-[:MEMBER_OF_IP_RULE]-(:IpRange{id:"0.0.0.0/0"})
OPTIONAL MATCH (n)<-[:FIREWALL_INGRESS]-(firewall_b:GCPFirewall)<-[:DENIED_BY]-(deny_rule:GCPIpRule{protocol:'all'})
WHERE ac.public_ip IS NOT NULL and allow_rule.fromport IS NOT NULL and allow_rule.toport IS NOT NULL and (
	deny_rule is NULL
	OR firewall_b.priority > firewall_a.priority
	OR NOT allow_rule.fromport IN RANGE(deny_rule.fromport, deny_rule.toport)
	OR NOT allow_rule.toport IN RANGE(deny_rule.fromport, deny_rule.toport)
)

RETURN count(*) as TotalCompleted
